title.narrative: Enhancing women’s role in peace and security in Yemen

description.narrative: The overall objective of the action is to promote a more inclusive and sustainable post-conflict stabilisation and peace process in Yemen. The specific objective of the action is to empower women activists and civil society organisations (CSOs) to engage in local peacebuilding processes and initiatives and raise awareness of women'’s peace and security concerns.

participating-org.narrative: National Foundation for Development and Human Rights

title.narrative: R2: Women’s activists are engaged in local peacebuilding processes and initiatives to address women’s security concerns.
2a: # of conflict-sensitive, relevant and consensus based local action plans produced and implemented.

comment.narrative: 2 per location
11 action plans were produced, revised for relevance and conflict/gender-sensitivity by the project team, resulting in 7 action plans being implemented with project funding

title.narrative: 2c: # peacebuilding initiatives set up by women action groups that focus on women’s security concerns and/or participation in peacebuilding.

comment.narrative: 2 per location

7 peacebuilding initiatives were set up by women’s actions groups focusing on women’s security concerns and peacebuilding with project seed funding. A further 8 initiatives were implemented autonomously with no project funding.

title.narrative: 2d: % of participants and beneficiaries that report having benefited from the initiatives or that initiatives have effectively addressed their target issue.

comment.narrative: 80% of feedback solicited is positive
Reporting on R2 indicators will take place in Y2, once the women, peace and security action groups are formed.

title.narrative: 2b: # and diversity of women actively involved in local level initiatives and community dialogues.

comment.narrative: 25/30 in each location

title.narrative: R1: Analysis is produced in up to 4 governorates on how women have been affected by the current crisis and on opportunities for engaging with or establishing local level initiatives for peace and stability.
1d: # of women’s activists and CSO representatives that demonstrate the skills needed to collect data and conduct analysis independently.

comment.narrative: 20 people in each location
22 women’s activists and CSO representatives (women and men) gained skills to collect data and analysis independently.

title.narrative: 1c: # and diversity of local women’s activists and CSO representatives engaged in collaborative analysis and setting of priorities.

comment.narrative: 25 people in each location, including women and men (25%) from different age groups, social and political backgrounds
62 women’s activists and CSO representatives (and 35 men) participated in collaborative analysis sessions in February 2017, October 2017 and between April-August 2018

title.narrative: 1b: Conflict and gender sensitive qualitative data gathered and analysed.

comment.narrative: data gathered and analysed in 4 locations
Achieved in Y1.

title.narrative: 1a: Conflict and gender sensitive research methodology is produced.

comment.narrative: methodology produced and tailored to 4 locations
Completed in Y1.

title.narrative: 1e: 1 research paper and 2 sets of written recommendations (1 per location) is produced that reflects new information and analysis on women’s security and role in the current conflict.

comment.narrative: 1 research paper and 2 sets of written recommendations (1 per location)
1 research paper and 2 policy briefs containing recommendations and analysis on women’s security and role produced.

title.narrative: R3 – There is increased awareness and openness among communities and formal and informal authorities of women’s security concerns and the role that women can play in peacebuilding processes and initiatives.
3a: # of people pro-actively engaging with awareness raising activities through taking part or providing feedback.

comment.narrative: 100 people in each location per year
Reporting on R3 indicators will take place in Y2, once the women, peace and security action groups are active.

title.narrative: 3c: # and diversity of community members and authorities involved in community dialogues.

comment.narrative: 100 people in each location per year
Reporting on R3 indicators will take place in Y2, once the women, peace and security action groups are active.

title.narrative: 3b: Level of community understanding of women’s security concerns.

comment.narrative: 70% of feedback solicited reflects awareness and understanding
Reporting on R3 indicators will take place in Y2, once the women, peace and security action groups are active.

title.narrative: 3d: # of authorities and community leaders who support the work of the action groups by engaging with initiatives, issuing statements of support or reflecting recommendations/actions from action plans in their own work.

comment.narrative: at least 10 authorities or community leaders take supportive action
Reporting on R3 indicators will take place in Y2, once the women, peace and security action groups are active.

title.narrative: 3e: # of national and international decision makers who receive and engage with analysis and lessons that emerge from the action.

comment.narrative: at least 100 people actively engaged
Reporting on R3 indicators will take place in Y2, once the women, peace and security action groups are active.

title.narrative: Overall Objective: To promote a more inclusive and sustainable post-conflict stabilisation and peace process in Yemen.

Women activists and CSOs have the skills to effectively engage on women’s security concerns and contribute to peacebuilding processes, at the local level in 2 governorates, along with communities and formal authorities becoming more receptive to their needs and demands.
Specific Objective: To empower women activists and CSOs to engage in local peacebuilding processes and initiatives and raise awareness of women’s peace and security concerns.
At least 25 women activists and CSO representatives participate in and successfully complete training sessions
At least 25 women activists and CSO representatives plan and implement local initiatives for peacebuilding
At least 25 women activists and CSO representatives participate in local peacebuilding initiatives and processes, and raise awareness about women’s role therein
